member.name: T:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.IMouseActions
member.summary: Provides methods representing basic mouse actions.

member.name: P:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.IMouseActions.Coordinates
member.summary: Returns current mouse coordinates.
Clicks the mouse at the last known or specified mouse coordinates.
member.param: The horizontal coordinate of the clicking point. If not specified, last known coordinate will be used.
The vertical coordinate of the clicking point. If not specified, last known coordinate will be used.
Name of the mouse button to be clicked. An exception is thrown if an unknown button name is provided. Supported button names are: left, middle, right, back, forward. The default value is left

List of possible keys or a single key name to depress while the click is being performed. Supported key names are: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Win. For example, in order to keep Ctrl+Alt depressed while clicking, provide the value of [, ]
Time to wait between pressing and releasing the mouse button. By default no delay is applied, which simulates a regular click.
How many times the click must be performed. One by default.
Duration of the pause between each click gesture. Only makes sense if is greater than one. 100ms by default.

member.name: M:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.IMouseActions.ContextClick(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.IList{Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.ModifierKey},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Right-clicks the mouse at the last known or specified mouse coordinates.
member.param: The horizontal coordinate of the clicking point. If not specified, last known coordinate will be used.
The vertical coordinate of the clicking point. If not specified, last known coordinate will be used.

List of possible keys or a single key name to depress while the click is being performed. Supported key names are: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Win. For example, in order to keep Ctrl+Alt depressed while clicking, provide the value of [, ]
Time to wait between pressing and releasing the mouse button. By default no delay is applied, which simulates a regular click.
How many times the click must be performed. One by default.
Duration of the pause between each click gesture. Only makes sense if is greater than one. 100ms by default.

member.summary: Double-clicks the mouse at the last known or specified mouse coordinates.
member.param: The horizontal coordinate of the clicking point. If not specified, last known coordinate will be used.
The vertical coordinate of the clicking point. If not specified, last known coordinate will be used.
Name of the mouse button to be clicked. An exception is thrown if an unknown button name is provided. Supported button names are: left, middle, right, back, forward. The default value is left

List of possible keys or a single key name to depress while the click is being performed. Supported key names are: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Win. For example, in order to keep Ctrl+Alt depressed while clicking, provide the value of [, ]
Time to wait between pressing and releasing the mouse button. By default no delay is applied, which simulates a regular click.
How many times the click must be performed. One by default.
Duration of the pause between each click gesture. Only makes sense if is greater than one. 100ms by default.

member.name: M:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.IMouseActions.MoveByOffset(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.ModifierKey},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Moves the mouse to the specified offset of the last known mouse coordinates.
member.param: The horizontal offset to which to move the mouse.
The vertical offset to which to move the mouse.

List of possible keys or a single key name to depress while the click is being performed. Supported key names are: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Win. For example, in order to keep Ctrl+Alt depressed while clicking, provide the value of [, ]
Time to wait between pressing and releasing the mouse button. By default no delay is applied, which simulates a regular click.

member.name: M:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.IMouseActions.Scroll(System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.ScrollDirection,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.ModifierKey})
member.summary: Scrolls the current screen by specified offset.
member.param: The horizontal coordinate of the scroll point.
The vertical coordinate of the scroll point.

The amount of horizontal wheel movement measured in wheel clicks (1 click ~ 120px). In case of vertical scroll, a positive value indicates that the wheel was rotated forward, away from the user; a negative value indicates that the wheel was rotated backward, toward the user. In case of horizontal scroll, a positive value indicates that the wheel was rotated to the right; a negative value indicates that the wheel was rotated to the left.
Direction of scrolling.

List of possible keys or a single key name to depress while the scroll is being performed. Supported key names are: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Win. For example, in order to keep Ctrl+Alt depressed while scrolling, provide the value of [, ]

member.name: M:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.IMouseActions.Hover(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Collections.Generic.IList{Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.ModifierKey},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Hovers the cursor on the current element, then moves it to the end element. The horizontal coordinate of the starting hover point. The vertical coordinate of the starting hover point. The horizontal coordinate of the ending hover point. Will be the same as the starting point by default. The vertical coordinate of the ending hover point. Will be the same as the starting point by default. List of possible keys or a single key name to depress while the hover is being performed. Supported key names are: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Win. For example, in order to keep Ctrl+Alt depressed while hovering, provide the value of [, ] The number of milliseconds between moving the cursor from the starting to the ending hover point. 500ms by default.

member.name: T:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.KeyAction
member.summary: Represents key action structure which could be used in chains in .

member.name: P:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.KeyAction.Pause
member.summary: Allows to set a delay between key input series. Either this property or text or virtualKeyCode must be provided.

member.name: P:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.KeyAction.Text
member.summary: Non-empty string of Unicode text to type (surrogate characters like smiles are not supported). Either this property or pause or virtualKeyCode must be provided.

member.name: P:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.KeyAction.VirtualKeyCode
member.summary: Valid virtual key code. The list of supported key codes is available at Virtual-Key Codes page. Either this property or pause or text must be provided. You can use short values of and for convenience here.

member.name: P:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.KeyAction.Down
member.summary: This property only makes sense in combination with virtualKeyCode. If set to true then the corresponding key will be depressed, false - released. By default the key is just pressed once. ! Do not forget to release depressed keys in your automated tests.

member.name: M:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.KeyAction.ToDictionary
member.summary: Converts this structure to KeyActions dictionary.

member.name: M:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Elements.Actions.IMouseActions.DoubleClick(System.Nullable{OpenQA.Selenium.Interactions.MouseButton},System.Collections.Generic.IList{Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.ModifierKey},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Double-clicks the mouse at the element coordinates. Name of the mouse button to be clicked. An exception is thrown if an unknown button name is provided. Supported button names are: left, middle, right, back, forward. The default value is left List of possible keys or a single key name to depress while the click is being performed. Supported key names are: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Win. For example, in order to keep Ctrl+Alt depressed while clicking, provide the value of [, ] Time to wait between pressing and releasing the mouse button. By default no delay is applied, which simulates a regular click. Duration of the pause between each click gesture. 100ms by default.

member.name: M:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Elements.Actions.IMouseActions.DragAndDrop(Aquality.WinAppDriver.Elements.Interfaces.IElement,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.ModifierKey},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Performs a drag-and-drop operation on the current element; drops it on target element.
member.param: The element on which the drop is performed.

List of possible keys or a single key name to depress while the click is being performed. Supported key names are: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Win. For example, in order to keep Ctrl+Alt depressed while clicking, provide the value of [, ]
Time to wait between pressing the left mouse button and moving the cursor to the ending drag point. 5000ms by default.

The vertical coordinate of the dropping point.

List of possible keys or a single key name to depress while the click is being performed. Supported key names are: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Win. For example, in order to keep Ctrl+Alt depressed while clicking, provide the value of [, ]
Time to wait between pressing the left mouse button and moving the cursor to the ending drag point. 5000ms by default.

Time to wait between pressing the left mouse button and moving the cursor to the ending drag point. 5000ms by default.

member.name: M:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Elements.Actions.IMouseActions.Hover(Aquality.WinAppDriver.Elements.Interfaces.IElement,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.ModifierKey},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Hovers the cursor on the current element, then moves it to the end element. Element which coordinates to be used as the ending hover point. List of possible keys or a single key name to depress while the hover is being performed. Supported key names are: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Win. For example, in order to keep Ctrl+Alt depressed while hovering, provide the value of [, ] The number of milliseconds between moving the cursor from the starting to the ending hover point. 500ms by default.

member.name: M:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Elements.Actions.IMouseActions.Hover(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.ModifierKey},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Hovers the cursor on the current element, then moves it to the end element. The horizontal coordinate of the ending hover point. The vertical coordinate of the ending hover point. List of possible keys or a single key name to depress while the hover is being performed. Supported key names are: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Win. For example, in order to keep Ctrl+Alt depressed while hovering, provide the value of [, ] The number of milliseconds between moving the cursor from the starting to the ending hover point. 500ms by default.

member.name: M:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Elements.Actions.IMouseActions.MoveFromElement(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.ModifierKey},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Moves the mouse from the current element. Works the same as to when ending hover point is offset to current element in the direction up left, half of the element size. List of possible keys or a single key name to depress while the hover is being performed. Supported key names are: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Win. For example, in order to keep Ctrl+Alt depressed while hovering, provide the value of [, ] The number of milliseconds between moving the cursor from the starting to the ending hover point. 500ms by default.

member.name: M:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Elements.Actions.IMouseActions.MoveToElement(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.ModifierKey},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Moves the mouse to the current element. Works the same as to when we don't move the mouse to other element afterwards. List of possible keys or a single key name to depress while the hover is being performed. Supported key names are: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Win. For example, in order to keep Ctrl+Alt depressed while hovering, provide the value of [, ] The number of milliseconds between moving the cursor from the starting to the ending hover point. 500ms by default.

member.summary: Moves the mouse to the specified offset of the top-left corner of the current element.
member.param: The horizontal offset to which to move the mouse.
The vertical offset to which to move the mouse.

List of possible keys or a single key name to depress while the hover is being performed. Supported key names are: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Win. For example, in order to keep Ctrl+Alt depressed while hovering, provide the value of [, ]
The number of milliseconds between moving the cursor from the starting to the ending hover point. 500ms by default.

member.name: M:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Elements.Actions.IMouseActions.Scroll(System.Int32,Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.ScrollDirection,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Aquality.WinAppDriver.Actions.ModifierKey})
member.summary: Scrolls the current screen by specified offset, starting from the current element.
member.param: The amount of horizontal wheel movement measured in wheel clicks (1 click ~ 120px). In case of vertical scroll, a positive value indicates that the wheel was rotated forward, away from the user; a negative value indicates that the wheel was rotated backward, toward the user. In case of horizontal scroll, a positive value indicates that the wheel was rotated to the right; a negative value indicates that the wheel was rotated to the left.
Direction of scrolling.

List of possible keys or a single key name to depress while the scroll is being performed. Supported key names are: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Win. For example, in order to keep Ctrl+Alt depressed while scrolling, provide the value of [, ]

member.name: T:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Elements.Actions.MouseActions
member.summary: Implements Mouse actions for a specific element. There is an issue with absolute coordinates calculation for elements found on Application session, so better to use the root session here if possible. Alternatively, you can move application to top left corner before doing mouse action. This might be addressed in future when fixed in appium-windows-driver

M:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Extensions.ProcessExtensions.ShowWindow(System.Diagnostics.Process,Aquality.WinAppDriver.Extensions.ShowCommand)
member.summary: Sends ShowCommand to the window associated with the specified process.
member.param: Process to send the command.
A command that controls how the window is to be shown.

member.name: T:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Extensions.ShowCommand
member.summary: Controls how the window is to be shown. This parameter is ignored the first time an application calls ShowWindow, if the program that launched the application provides a STARTUPINFO structure. Otherwise, the first time ShowWindow is called, the value should be the value obtained by the WinMain function in its nCmdShow parameter. For more information, please visit https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/nf-winuser-showwindow.

member.name: F:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Extensions.ShowCommand.Hide
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Extensions.ShowCommand.ShowNormal
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Extensions.ShowCommand.ShowMinimized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Extensions.ShowCommand.ShowMaximized
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Extensions.ShowCommand.ShowNoActivate
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to , except that the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Extensions.ShowCommand.Show
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Extensions.ShowCommand.Minimize
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Extensions.ShowCommand.ShowMinimizedNoActive
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to , except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Extensions.ShowCommand.ShowNoActive
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to , except that the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Extensions.ShowCommand.Restore
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Extensions.ShowCommand.ShowDefault
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_ value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.

member.name: F:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Extensions.ShowCommand.ForceMinimize
member.summary: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is not responding. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.

member.summary: Defines if any process with the specified name is running.
member.param: Pure name of the process (e.g. for WinAppDriver.exe pure name is WinAppDriver).
member.returns: True if any process by the name specified was found, false otherwise.

member.summary: Defines if any executable with the specified name is running.
member.param: Name of the executable (e.g. WinAppDriver.exe).
member.returns: True if any process was found by the specified executable name, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Aquality.WinAppDriver.Utilities.IProcessManager.Start(System.String)
member.summary: Starts a process resource by specifying the name of a document or application file and associates the resource with a new System.Diagnostics.Process component.
member.param: The name of a document or application file to run in the process.
member.returns: A new that is associated with the process resource, or null if no process resource is started.
